name: GetMinimumWageRates
description:
Retrieve minimum wage rates by country or tax authority.

This tool retrieves minimum wage rates for specified countries or tax authorities. It should be called when users need detailed information about minimum wage regulations in a specific region.

parameters.name: effective_date
parameters.description: Specify the date (yyyy-mm-dd) to retrieve minimum wage rates effective on that day.

value_schema.description: The minimum wage rates that are effective on the date specified using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: country_workday_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for minimum wage rates. Specify 1 country ID. Retrieve ID using GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the country for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: response_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of minimum wage rates to return in a single response. Defaults to 20, with a maximum of 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: response_offset_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object to return. Use with 'limit' for paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payroll_tax_authorities_ids
parameters.description: A list of Workday IDs for payroll tax authorities to retrieve minimum wage rates. Specify one or more IDs.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the payroll tax authority for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/taxAuthorities. You can specify 1 or more tax authority query parameters. Example: taxAuthority=taxAuthority1&taxAuthority=taxAuthority2.

parameters.name: include_local_tax_authorities
parameters.description: Set to true to include local tax authority wage rates along with federal and state rates. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If true, returns minimum wage rates for local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state rates. If false (default), only returns federal and state minimum wage rates.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: asOfDate
parameters.description: The minimum wage rates that are effective on the date specified using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The minimum wage rates that are effective on the date specified using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the country for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: includeLocalTaxAuthorities
parameters.description: If true, returns minimum wage rates for local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state rates. If false (default), only returns federal and state minimum wage rates.

value_schema.description: If true, returns minimum wage rates for local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state rates. If false (default), only returns federal and state minimum wage rates.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: taxAuthority
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the payroll tax authority for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/taxAuthorities. You can specify 1 or more tax authority query parameters. Example: taxAuthority=taxAuthority1&taxAuthority=taxAuthority2.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the payroll tax authority for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/taxAuthorities. You can specify 1 or more tax authority query parameters. Example: taxAuthority=taxAuthority1&taxAuthority=taxAuthority2.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
